definition: time limit/deadline/allotted time
variant of 期[qi1]/period/cycle
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]
limit/bound/to set a limit (on)
deadline
deadline/final time limit (for project)

sentences.english: He asked for extension of his residence permit .
sentences.chinese: 他要求延长居留证的期限。

sentences.english: The customs house shall make examination on the person under custody within the legal detention period.
sentences.chinese: 海关应当在法定扣留期限内对被扣留人进行审查。

sentences.english: The value of papers declines monotonically after the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 报告的价值在期限后递减。

sentences.english: The system is expected to last 10 years, and have no salvage value at the end of the period.
sentences.chinese: 该系统预计在过去10年，并没有残值在期限结束时。

sentences.english: Ask your student-loan servicer to extend your payback period.
sentences.chinese: 请求你的学生贷款商延长你的还款期限。

sentences.english: The amortization period shall not be less than one year.
sentences.chinese: 摊销期限不得少于一年。

sentences.english: The exit goods for processing shall be shipped back to China within the time limit as prescribed by the customs.
sentences.chinese: 出境加工货物应当在海关规定的期限内复运进境。

sentences.english: The deadline for achieving the goals is 2015.
sentences.chinese: 实现这些目标的最后期限是2015年。

sentences.english: Don't let tasks go on indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 不要让工作无期限地进行下去。

sentences.english: You may be accountable to complete projects to deadline and under budget.
sentences.chinese: 你可能要负责在期限之内以既定的预算完成各项任务。

sentences.english: But just minutes ago, Lawyer Li Li told me that the Supreme Court regulations are that verdicts can take as long as six months.
sentences.chinese: 但刚才李立律师告诉我，高院规定的期限是六个月。

sentences.english: This is true for both 36 as well as 60 month loans.
sentences.chinese: 这同样适用于期限为36个月和60个月的贷款项目。

sentences.english: The delivery deadline may act according to the actual situation arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 交货期限可根据实际情况商订。

sentences.english: the deadline fall in the vacation or holiday , it can be put off in turn .
sentences.chinese: 不过期限的最后一日如果是节假日，可以顺延。

sentences.english: The period of effectiveness an authorizing contract may not exceed 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 许可合同的有效期限一次不得超过十年。

sentences.english: You get to set the deadlines, and manage your own priorities.
sentences.chinese: 你擅长设定最后期限，自行安排事情的优先秩序。

definition: time limit
grace period/period of grace
age limit/fixed number of years
to fall due (loan etc)/to expire (visa etc)/to mature (investment bond etc)
closing date (of contract)/maturity (of an investment bond)
the end of fixed period in office/expiration of a term
to expire/to run out/to come to an end

to agree on sth (after discussion)/to conclude a bargain/to arrange/to promise/to stipulate/to make an appointment/stipulated (time, amount, quality etc)/an arrangement/a deal/appointment/undertaking/commitment/understanding/engagement/stipulation
to set a time limit/time limit/deadline
period of validity/sell-by date
effectiveness for a given period of time/prescription (law)/aging (metallurgy)
deadline/final time limit (for project)
to delay/to extend/to postpone/to defer
one year period (in a contract or budget)
to be overdue/to fail to meet a deadline/to be behind in doing sth
to promise/to undertake to do something/commitment
